topic.title: Good learning resources to zeronet web development
topic.body:
I am trying to learn how to make websites for Zeronet, it's easy to get started with a site, and to serve static content. But I found the ZeroFrame documentation hard to use, if you are completely new.

I have completed the ZeroChat tutorial, but is there any place I can find further information. I have started to look at some of the sample sites, to get a better understanding of the structure of a bigger zites, but it's a lot to take in, if you are new.

ZeroFrame doc: http://127.0.0.1:43110/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe/
ZeroChat tutorial: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:99:ZeroChat+tutorial

1509649171_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
> [parkour86](#comment_8_1EXv9ZukJjnSeYBijEBwFZZNBdEzEvvs9M): Under "My Repos" it lists all the repos I have visited. How do I remove the ones I don't want to see in the list? [...]

You can remove them from ZeroHello (the start page), in the sidebar there's a section called 'merged: gitcenter'. From the dropdown (3 dots) there is an option to delete the repo/site

1511097948_19t3AncxBxySDwgUBD6MGDRTeMdA2.body:
> [naeui7tycw9p35y9](#comment_20_1CaVUegZMXMjmRXtq5q3eZDqdtsoNvgep): i submitted a torrent file [...]

The file is different, because it is parsed using [torrent-parser](https://www.npmjs.com/package/torrent-parser), and then saved to a json file. When you download the torrent file, it is getting reassembled using the information in the `data.json` file

> [sirenyc](#comment_203_19sggoAZ4hcorrrfWoFWP9rwfpVsL29cnZ): Increase the limit for all users to upload more on the site!

I have updated the max upload size from 1mb to 25mb.

> [sirenyc](#comment_204_19sggoAZ4hcorrrfWoFWP9rwfpVsL29cnZ): Thx!Put more!Create a zerome or place your contacts on the site in case you need to contact.

I have bumped the max upload to 40 MB, this should be sufficient, otherwise send me a message if you run out of space. I have also added my contact information to the site. :)

1511866479_1CaVUegZMXMjmRXtq5q3eZDqdtsoN.body: I think transmission is able to run a script on completion. I have never tried it thought
